definition: to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross

sentences.english: Men of the sword had overthrown nobles and kings.
sentences.chinese: 手执利剑的人已经推翻了王室贵胄。

sentences.english: The son overthrew father, but he would be repenting forever and crime sense followed the son.
sentences.chinese: 儿子推翻父亲，但伴随儿子的将是永远忏悔和罪恶感。

sentences.english: They conspired to overthrow the government.
1910 - Portugal overthrows its monarchy and declares itself a republic.
sentences.chinese: 1910年的今天，葡萄牙推翻君主制宣布共和。

sentences.english: Could Kim Jong Il's regime really be brought undone by K-pop and South Korean soap operas?
sentences.chinese: 金正日政权真的有可能被韩国音乐和肥皂剧推翻吗？
法官，5比4，推翻法人献金限制。

sentences.english: In 1969, Gadhafi overthrew the Eastern tribal King Idris.
sentences.chinese: 1969年，卡扎菲推翻了东部的部落酋长伊德里斯。

sentences.english: When it cannot, it typically refutes the subject at hand.
sentences.chinese: 如果它无法这么做，通常就会推翻当刻的主题。

sentences.english: We overthrow the old qc group, because they are out of date.
sentences.chinese: 我们推翻了老旧的品管组织，因为他们已经过时了。

sentences.english: For 40 years, Karten and colleagues have worked to upend this thinking.
sentences.chinese: 40年来，卡特和他的同事都在试图推翻这种认识。

sentences.english: The rebel factions made common cause to overthrow the regime.
sentences.chinese: 各造反派联合起来共同推翻政府。

sentences.english: Will Judge Hudson's decision be upheld on appeal?
sentences.chinese: 法官哈德孙河的决定将会被支持推翻吗？

sentences.english: Obviously the solution is to resist and overthrow the oppressors.
sentences.chinese: 显然，解决办法就是对抗并推翻这些压迫者。

sentences.english: The king accepted the coup that overthrew Mr Thaksin in 2006.
sentences.chinese: 国王认可了2006年推翻他信的那场政变。

sentences.english: After the overthrow of the Qing dynasty, Shanxi was held by warlord Yan Xishan.
sentences.chinese: 清朝被推翻后，山西被军阀阎锡山占领。

sentences.english: Any law that discriminates agai t gays could be ripe for reversal.
sentences.chinese: 任何歧视同性恋的法律均有可能快被推翻。

definition: to recover one's power or authority/restoration (of a past regime)
